result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon S Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shannon S Grant is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shannon S Grant was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Shannon S Grant was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: COUNTS 2 & 3 OF THIS CASE CONCURRENT

miscConds.notes:

THIS IS TO BE PAID THROUGH PROBATION.
$250 BOND FORWARDED TO PROBATION OFFICE TO BE APPLIED TO COSTS
DOMESTIC ABUSE COUNSELING AS RECOMMENDED BY THE AGENT

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shannon S Grant in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was previously provided to the defendant.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to accept the offer.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 2 & 3.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.  Defendant agrees.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 & 3.  
Ct. 1 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 2 & 3:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
Domestic Abuse Surcharge = $100.00 on each count
DNA Surcharge = $200.00 on each count
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Domestic Abuse Counseling as recommended by the Agent
bond to be applied.
Payment Plan for balance:  $50.00/month commencing in December.

Ct. 1 to be dismissed.
Return date on October 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
***Additional $250.00 cash bond ordered 9/18/14.  No conditions as Waiver of No Contact Provision was previously filed.

Defendant Shannon S Grant in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions defendant on his failure to appear.  Defendant states thought it was Tuesday.  Atty Hendee requests cash bond of $200.00.  Defendant states he will be here for future hearings and is not going anywhere.  Defendant states he wishes to take the state's offer.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant will be quashed.  Court will set a further cash bond.
  Return date scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets an additional $250.00 cash bond.

Defendant Shannon S Grant not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests a Warrant based on non-appearance.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant authorized.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Shannon S Grant in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states defendant previously waived his right to counsel and have a pretrial with the DA.  He did not appear for that conference.  State dismissed his witness since he did not know what defendants' intentions were.  Defendant responds and states he just forgot about that pretrial.  Does wish to have a pretrial conference with the DA and continues to waive his right to counsel.  Court questions defendant as to that waiver.  
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts defendants waiver to counsel and will allow defendant to have a pretrial with the DA.
Atty Hendee requests pretrial be held today.  Mr. Grant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Pretrial today.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 24, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Shannon S Grant in court.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that time limits were waived at the last hearing and a status was set to see if defendant was going to get an Attorney.  Court questions the defendant.  
Defendant states that he did speak with an Attorney but he advised him to speak with the DA.   Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney. Court accepts defendant's waiver of Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing; time limits waived.  
Set pre-trial with DA.
bond continued.  

**Defendant is to go down to the DA's office to get a Pre-Trial date before he leaves today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 11:30 am.
WAIVER OF NO CONTACT PROVISION OF BOND
Status conference on June 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.

with conditions:
*No contact with Natasha Driscoll.  Court will allow a 3rd party contact with Ms. Driscoll for the business purposes only.  
*No Contact with Ms. Driscoll's residence
*Defendant allowed one time to the residence to get his belongings with the Sheriff's Department

Defendant Shannon S Grant in court, in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court finds probable cause.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Atty Hendee requests a $250 cash bond with conditions:
*No contact with Natasha Driscoll.
*Defendant allowed one time to the residence to get his belongings with the Sheriff's Department
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant states that he has ties to the community.  Defendant states that they own the bar together.  Atty Hendee states that the victim signed the 72 hour no contact.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*No contact with Natasha Driscoll.  Court will allow a 3rd party contact with Ms. Driscoll for the business purposes only.  
*No Contact with Ms. Driscoll's residence
*Defendant allowed one time to the residence to get his belongings with the Sheriff's Department

Court advises defendant his right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant waives time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Set Status.
  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.
